normalized_poster.payload_xml: <?xml version='1.0' encoding='utf-8'?> <treasuredBiomesPoster continent="North America"> <title>North America: Fire Springs, Wild Water, and High Country</title> <biomes> <biome> <name>Yellowstone Plateau</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/yellowstone-geyser-erupting-158620/" /> <description>Yellowstone sits on powerful heat below the ground. Geysers, hot springs, and steaming basins share space with forests and meadows where bison, elk, and wolves move through a living landscape.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Chihuahuan Desert</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/person-walking-at-white-sand-dune-8850972/" /> <description>The Chihuahuan Desert is a high, dry region of rugged mountains and wide basins. Cacti, agaves, and tough shrubs survive heat, wind, and sudden storms across this desert grassland.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Canadian Boreal Forest</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/snow-covered-trees-8452441/" /> <description>Canada’s boreal forest is a vast belt of spruce, pine, bogs, and lakes. It stores huge amounts of carbon and provides habitat for moose, bears, wolves, and migrating birds.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Belize Barrier Reef</name> <image url="https://www.shutterstock.com/image-photo/aerial-view-belize-barrier-reef-2570358113" /> <description>Belize’s barrier reef runs along warm, clear water filled with coral gardens. Sea turtles, rays, and bright fish weave through the reef, while mangroves and seagrass protect the coast.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Bay of Fundy</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/people-walking-on-beach-near-cliffs-3225533/" /> <description>The Bay of Fundy has the world’s highest tides. Water rises and falls dramatically each day, feeding rich coastal ecosystems and carving cliffs, beaches, and sea stacks along the shore.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Greenland Ice Sheet</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/arctic-ice-glacier-in-greenland-3747254/" /> <description>Greenland’s ice sheet is a massive cap of compacted snow and ice. It feeds glaciers that calve into the sea, and its meltwater shapes rivers, lakes, and blue channels on the surface.</description> </biome> <biome> <name>Rocky Mountains</name> <image url="https://www.pexels.com/photo/photography-of-a-lake-surrounded-by-mountains-2398220/" /> <description>The Rocky Mountains form a long backbone of peaks, forests, and alpine valleys. Snowpack feeds major rivers, while elk, bears, and eagles thrive across rugged high country.</description> </biome> </biomes> </treasuredBiomesPoster>
